data.title: Low Quality Meat
data.text: I had 2 chorizo tacos and 2 asada tacos. Both had been cooked with too much oil and were very greasy. The steak was low quality and had an off flavor. I don't expect filet mignon in a carne asada taco but I have eaten plenty of them  (check my other reviews) and this meat was below the quality I have had in the same area (Northern CO) for about the same price ($10 for 4 tacos). The chorizo was better than the steak. The marinade on it was a simple spicy marinade that tasted like red pepper and vegetable oil and some pepper. Not bad but not great. The tortillas were good as was the salsa bar. 7 did kinds of salsa and all pretty good. Service was fine.

data.title: Other reviewers are right
data.text:
Ate here in August with a co-worker after reading the other positive reviews on TripAdvisor.  Was also genuinely pleased with our meals.

I had the enchilada plate with green sauce and my fried had a guacamole tostada.  Both were quite good and worth recommending.

While we were eating, we looked around and noticed about 1/3 of the restaurant guests were drinking large glasses of a vibrant orange drink.  The waitress told us that was a house drink made with cantaloupe, vanilla, and ice cream, among other ingredients.  We got a sample, and it was indeed tasty and very unique!  Definitely try this drink!

The only less-than-positive comment I have is that the menu doesn't contains few small or ala carte items (a single enchilada, taco, etc). If you only want to eat a small quantity, this might not be a good restaurant choice.

data.title: Authentic and quite good
data.text: Better than average for Mexican restaurants. Not in a "nice" part of town but not bad, either. Fast, friendly service.

data.title: Excellent, authentic Mexican food
data.text: Excellent, authentic Mexican food.  Salsa bar is outstanding and the wait staff is very accommodating.  Bought salsa to have at home. When looking for good Mexican, affordable food I would strongly recommend coming here.  Whenever my son comes to town, this is where he wants to eat.

data.title: mexican
data.text:
had the fajites which were great - the wait staff were very good and prompt - had the small grandkids with us and they made sure they had finger food to keep them busy
place is a small family run eatery in with a grocery store - lots of locals eat there

data.title: Great authentic Mexican restaurant
data.text: We had forgotten about this little jem. What a great place! Great affordable food with friendly service. This is now our "go to" place for mexican food. I'm celiac and I can eat there.

data.title: Fantastic Fresh Salsa with Salsa Bar!
data.text:
Wow, fresh, delicious & flavorful food, generous kid's portions -  what a deal!
Fantastic fresh salsa bar with great variety.
The hostess and waitresses were all so kind, friendly, and relaxed.
Husband had the fish and shrimp tacos.  Pretty good he said.
Son had the kid's meal with chicken - delicious esp rice/beans and it was large enough for two kids.
Would come again.

data.title: Authenic and delicious
data.text: Amazing meal! I love trying something different each time I go there and have never been disappointed. Excellent service and consistently awesome food. Highly recommend.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: Burritos, tortas, tacos, Fajitas, menudos only on weekends. Everything is made in house and tortillas and bread are made daily.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Fresh delicious food, friendly servers, clean establishment! Servers are polite, friendly and smiling, they're knowledgeable and informative. I had the fajitas,they were amazing and served with freshly made tortillas rice and beans. My coworkers had Burritos, Chilaquiles, Tacos and Queso fundido. Everyone loved the food. This place exceeded our expectations and we learned they are a family owned and run business. Makes us feel even better to know we are supporting locally and not big chains. We can't wait to return!

data.title: WOW - SO GLAD WE TRIED THIS!
data.text:
Read a TripAdvisor review on this restaurant, and decided to try it out. This restaurant is NOT affiliated with the Taqueria Los Comales in LOVELAND, CO. Located in the same building as a grocery market - called Jerry's.  At first was a little apprehensive with the outside area and location, but once you went inside it was a cute little mexican cafe.  Obviously locals go here, as well as Newbie's, like ourselves.  Their Salsa Bar is amazing - tons to choose from to doctor up your dish.  Staff was very friendly.  Service was quick.  Food was tasty.  More of a "Mexico" flare, than a typical mexican restaurant. I ordered the Burrito Al Pastor (marinated pork) with green chili.  The beans were good - flavorful but a tad on the bland side.  Rice was tasty, fluffy.  The Burrito itself was flavorful.  The marinated pork looked a lot like Chorizo, and I had to clarify if I had the right burrito. From what I could tell, they did not have shredded pork or ground beef as an option for the burrito filling.  I've never had green chili made like this before, but it was more of a dark green stew with green chili's and looked to be green peppers.  My friend ordered the Chilaquiles and she too said her meal was delicious - beans very flavorful.

They also serve breakfast all day.  On the kitchen's counter there were large jars filled with Agua de Horchata (rice drink), Agua de Melon (cantaloupe water), and some sort of lemonade drink.

PRICE:  Cheap Eats - very reasonable.
STAFF:  Very nice, quick and efficient service.
FOOD:  Very Good and tasty!  THEY DO NOT SERVE BEER or ALCOHOL.

All in all, I was pleasantly surprised and glad we tried this place out.  If you're in the mood for a little something different - GO TO TAQUERIA LOS COMALES.

data.title: Oh yeah!
data.text: This is the place for authentic Mexican (and I have experience!) It's divey in a good way. Service was quick, efficient, and helpful. They had no problem doing special orders. I had the tacos and thought I was in the D.F. of Mexico! The salsa bar had an incredible varieties of fresh salsas, chiles toreados and little pungent limes. I had the agua de melon, which was refreshing and tasty, but not as fresh as I've had, but it's midwinter!! A great find.

data.title: What a great experience
data.text: Needed a Mexican Food Fix.  This did the trick.  I was impressed with the food and service.  Everything was very good and the portions large.  Will go back again.

data.title: Hidden Greeley Mexican Goodness
data.text:
A friend of mine and I went to Taqueria Los Comales for lunch during the week. Here are a few things to consider:

1. You WILL receive some fresh salsa to go with a basket of chips! ENJOY! 
2. The portions are pretty hefty, so make sure you have a hefty appetite. 
3. If you want extra tortillas, they cost $.75, which is super inexpensive! 

Hope you enjoy your visit!

data.title: Excellent Authentic Food!
data.text: I have eaten here twice.  The first time I ordered Caldo de Res and it was excellent.  The second time I ordered chilaquiles with the green sauce.  Again, excellent.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for authentic Mexican food.  I have to laugh when I read things like this in a review "The menu included the unusual dishes...".  Gringo translation: "The menu included authentic dishes...".  Be a little adventurous and order authentic food.  Don't just go for the tacos and burritos.  I'm sure their tacos are very good, but try something you have never had or even heard of.  Ask the wait staff for a description or a suggestion.  You won't be disappointed.  If you have spent any time in Mexico you should recognize the menu items.  Where my wife and I vacation (the Yucatan), burritos aren't even on the menu in most palaces unless they cater to people from the US.  In Northern Mexico, from what I've read, they do burritos.  Most of the food you get in the US is TexMex, which is northern Mexican influenced american food.  The first time they set a bowl of caldo de res on your table you'll go "wow, I've never seen a bowl of soup like that".  And that is what you should go for.  Something different.

data.title: We're still smiling..
data.text:
This very casual restaurant was terrific! The food was so fresh and affordable.

The menu included the unusual dishes but took a unique twist with their taco selection. 
Which included: tongue, cheek and tripas tacos, along with the usual chicken and beef.

So delicious.

data.title: Good street tacos
data.text: Finally found a decent Mexican restaurant in Greeley that is almost as good as those in SoCal.  Had tried another with good reviews but with disappointing gringo/Mex good.  Full menu with good options at a reasonable price.  Clean and neat.  Located close to Centential Historical Park which makes it a great place for a late lunch.
